intro: Chaetospora neesii, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
